page.title: 11THE TOM COBLEY.
page.content: The Tom Cobley Tavern got its name from the character in the folk song"Uncle Tom Cobley an' All"who lived in these parts from 1762 to 1844.The Tom Cobley is a free house,so the owners can sell any brewery's beer and distiller's spirits. This tavern was first licensed in 1589.The building is made of 60cm.wide walls of cob,stone and granite.The tavern was thatched but the whole of the first floor has now been built up and it now has a slate roof. When you go inside the tavern you can see many unusual objects.There is a bier wheel made into a light.Over the door is a charred,carved oak panel from the original public house.The main bar is part wood panelled and there is a very old settle.It is 1.67m.high and 1.67m.wide.It was made like this to keep out the draughts.
